ecelerations 
• Decelerations are transient episodes of decrease of FHR below the baseline of more than 15 bpm lasting at least
15 seconds. The specific features of the deceleration inform the classification.
• When describing decelerations specify:
o their timing in relation to the peaks of the contractions
o the duration of the individual decelerations
o whether or not the fetal heart rate returns to baseline
o how long they have been present for
o whethe
